main event: Two officers driving in northwest Montana reported seeing a bright light in the northwest sky that appeared to be an aircraft at first, but had no trail or obstruction lights. The object was an intense bright light, rapidly changing direction and moving at a high rate of speed. As it approached the observers, it broke into several smaller lights that disappeared seemingly instantly.
interesting points: The object was described as an intense bright light that was rapidly changing direction and moving at a high rate of speed.
As the object approached the observers, it broke into several smaller lights that disappeared seemingly instantly.
The sighting was reported by two officers driving in northwest Montana, approximately 10 miles northwest of Lakeside.
Other sightings were reported in the area, including a 60-foot plastic balloon loose in the vicinity of Sheridan, Wyoming, and a possible decaying satellite payload package.
The report indicates that no acquisitions by radar were reported.
sighted object: a bright light that broke into several smaller lights
location: northwest Montana, approximately 10 miles northwest of Lakeside
